Humans cannot exist without nature. Yet any party that has no legal rights in the human world is systematically victimized. We need to recognize that nature has rights and enforce those rights.
Competition and consumer choice are key to creating the sustainable energy future we want. Good insights from @nrgenergy's @NRGMauricio on how to make that happen in Pennsylvania.
Hiding in Plain Sight: 95 Pounds of Insights

Responsible for leading the development and execution of company-wide sustainability strategy and initiatives as well as help advance and drive better understanding of sustainability standards and solutions for new and existing NRG customers.

In addition to my corporate job, I am honored to teach part-time as Professor of Practice at ASU, home to the world's leading School of Sustainability and over 400 sustainability scholars and scientists, and also home to one of the nation's top business schools and top supply chain management programs, among others.
Consultant, Walton Sustainability Solutions Initiative, Global Institute of Sustainability

Working with the Rob and Melani Walton Sustainability Solutions Initiatives team, led design and development of a groundbreaking Executive Master's for Sustainability Leadership (EMSL). This 13-month hybrid program launched in January 2014 at ASU, home to the world's leading School of Sustainability and over 300 sustainability scholars and scientists, and also home to one of the nation's top business schools and top supply chain management programs, among others. The EMSL, in which I teach as adjunct faculty, is designed for busy professionals in or near the field of sustainability to help them accelerate and scale their efforts to advance sustainable outcomes as well as to advance their careers in their organizations.

As part of the Corporate Sustainability team, in this role I am responsible for all the social dimensions of sustainability: Human rights, labor practices, environmental justice, prevention of things like forced or child labor or human trafficking, protection of vulnerable workers like students or migrants, etc... I am also actively involved in shaping global policy efforts, working with our government affairs teams, actively engage with external stakeholders, and participate in and/or lead industry-wide working groups on these topics. I continue to oversee Dell's environmental philanthropy, and lead Dell's ground-breaking partnership in technology-enabled genomics with TGen and the NMTRC.

Lead sustainability business integration, information strategy, measurement, and reporting, as well as supporting advocacy, policy, and goal-setting working with internal and external stakeholders. Also responsible for leading Dell’s groundbreaking partnership with Phoenix-based TGen (Translational Genomics Research Institute).
Applied Ethics of Science, Technology and Engineering

Degree focused on the ethical issues arising from the multiple challenges involved in balancing economic, technological, environmental, social and cultural development in a world increasingly affected by science, technology and engineering. Covered ethics and ethical systems relevant to science and technology, as well as new challenges posed by rapidly evolving sociotechnical systems in such areas as:	• energy, environment and development	• genetic engineering and biotechnology	• information and communication technology	• nanotechnology	• robotics and autonomous technologies	• bioethics for modern healthcare systems	• risk assessment	• technology and security

Bruno's deep experience in organizational sustainability practice and policy as well as his background in marketing has made him an ideal partner and leader in creating and developing the Executive Master's for Sustainability Leadership (EMSL) at Arizona State University. It is a pleasure to work with Bruno because of his clear vision and willingness to collaborate on all levels to ensure that an optimal program and student experience is delivered. This EMSL program will empower current and future leaders to implement successful sustainability strategies and practices providing immediate impact on their organizations and the world, and I cannot think of a more ideal person helping to design this program than Bruno.

Bruno’s depth and breadth of experience and knowledge in the area of sustainability and his ability to apply his experience pragmatically in the development of the curriculum have enabled him to guide and lead the development team in creating a program that is extremely well positioned to enable the Sustainability Leaders of tomorrow for success.
